title: Lloyds boosted by lower PPI payments - BBC News
text:
Lloyds boosted by lower PPI payments 22 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright Reuters Lloyds Banking Group has reported a 158% increase in annual pre-tax profits to £4.24bn as a result of a reduction in payment protection insurance (PPI) provisions. 
Provisions for PPI declined from £4bn to £1bn. 
However, underlying profits fell to £7.9bn, down from £8.1bn. 
The UK government's stake in Lloyds has now fallen below 5% and it has said it wants to return the bank to full private ownership this year. 
On Tuesday HSBC reported a $7.1bn (£5.7bn) pre-tax profit for 2016, down 62% on the $18.9bn reported a year earlier. 
The government spent £20.3bn to acquire a 43% stake in Lloyds at the height of the financial crisis. Related Topics
